bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Otto L. Bettmann, April 15, 1948

div1.p: Hench informs Bettmann that he has sent Lyons at the Hall of Fame some yellow fever photographs made from material Hench purchased from Bettmann.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Otto L. Bettmann, April 15, 1948
div1.opener:
April 15, 1948
Dr. Otto Bettmann
Bettmann Archives
211-A East 57th Street
New York 22, New York
My dear Doctor Bettmann:
div1.p:
I have been helping the Hall of Fame (Dr. Angel and Miss Lyons)
assemble photographic and other material for their souvenir program on the
occasion of the unveiling of a bust of Walter Reed in the Hall of Fame on
May 20.

I sent them a large amount of data that I had myself and also
suggested they include one or two items to show the horrors of yellow fever
before Reed discovered how to control it, since the present generation doesn't
know what the horrors were. As a sample of what I meant, I sent them two or
three photographs made from the material I purchases from you. I told Miss
Lyons to get in touch with you to get your permission to rent or copy this
material. I assume that she will do so.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
